intro: Stylocoryna macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf stylocoryna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
